*div1 type="summary"* *p*Thomas Barnett to Austin, July 6, 1830. Order of court authorizing Austin to make a certain disposition of land belonging to his brother's estate,*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Department of*location_mentioned* Bexar*/location_mentioned**/p* *p*Jurisdiction of *location_mentioned*Austin*/location_mentioned**/p* *p*To the *person_mentioned*Citizen Thomas Barnett constitutional Alcalde of the jurisdiction of *location_mentioned*Austin*/location_mentioned*.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*The petition of*person_mentioned* Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned* a Citizen of the Jurisdiction aforesaid, With respect represents that *person_mentioned*James E. B. Austin*/person_mentioned* late of the Jurisdiction aforesaid died some time since leaving his surviving *person_mentioned*widow */person_mentioned*and an infant male *person_mentioned*Child */person_mentioned*now aged about nineteen months. That at the time of the death of the said *person_mentioned*James*/person_mentioned*, he held in his name an undivided *location_mentioned*fourth part in a league of land */location_mentioned*granted by the*person_mentioned* Mexican Government*/person_mentioned* to *person_mentioned*Elias R. Wightman*/person_mentioned*, lying at the *location_mentioned*mouth of the Colorado River*/location_mentioned* and being the same part of which has been laid off by *person_mentioned*Elias R. Wightman,*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*persons */person_mentioned*interested into squares and lots with a view of fixing upon this same as a *location_mentioned*town site*/location_mentioned*, Your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*further represents that the *location_mentioned*fourth part of the said League*/location_mentioned* which is in the name of the said *person_mentioned*James E. B. Austin*/person_mentioned* is really the property of your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*which he will make appear as soon as circumstances will permit and that the other three fourths are owned in unequal portions by*person_mentioned* H H League*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Ira Ingram*/person_mentioned* and the said *person_mentioned*Elias R. Wightman*/person_mentioned*. The said League of land lying immediately at the *location_mentioned*mouth of the Colorado River and partly on the Bay of Matagorda,*/location_mentioned* is thought to be an eligible situation upon which to fix a *location_mentioned*town site*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*That the persons now interested in the *location_mentioned*said league of land*/location_mentioned* wish to associate themselves together for the purpose of laying off a *location_mentioned*town*/location_mentioned* on said league by which it will be rendered more valuable and more immediately productive.*/p*
*p*That in order to effect this and enable him to act, he should be vested with power and authority to act and bind himself in his *person_mentioned*representative capacity*/person_mentioned* (so long as he acts in that capacity) as *person_mentioned*administrator of the said James E. B. Austin */person_mentioned*deceased to do and perform all and every act, Jointly with the other persons interested in the said league or with such others as may hereafter become legally interested therein with power and authority to sell lease or otherwise bind the said land or make donations thereof. Jointly with the said other *person_mentioned*persons */person_mentioned*interested, and your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*prays such other and further relief in the premises, as from Equity, justice and law he may be entitled to and as in duty etc.*/p*
*p*(Signed) *person_mentioned*S. F. Austin.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Austin */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="07-06-1830">6th July 1830*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*Department of *location_mentioned*Bexar*/location_mentioned**/p* *p* *location_mentioned*Jurisdiction of Austin*/location_mentioned**/p* Having read and maturely considered the facts stated in the foregoing petition and the evidence advanced in support thereof it is by reason thereof and of the law, and it having been made clearly to appear to my satisfaction that the *location_mentioned*land */location_mentioned*mentioned in the foregoing petition when laid off in part or in whole, into *location_mentioned*town lots*/location_mentioned* will greatly increase the value thereof and will besides render it more immediately productive. It is therefore ordered, adjudged, and decreed that *location_mentioned*Stephen F Austin administrator of the estate of James E B Austin */location_mentioned*deceased be authorized and empowered and he is hereby authorized and empowered to form and connect himself into an association with the present *person_mentioned*owners */person_mentioned*of the league of land refered to in *person_mentioned*Plff*/person_mentioned*. petition or with any other *person_mentioned*persons */person_mentioned*who may hereafter acquire an interest therein necessary to carry views of the said association into full and compleat effect having for object the establishment of a *location_mentioned*town */location_mentioned*on the said league of land—and in order to vest the said *person_mentioned*Stephen F Austin */person_mentioned*with full and compleat powers to do whatever may be necessary to the completion of the object set forth in the foregoing petition. It is further ordered adjudged and decreed that the said *person_mentioned*Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned* is hereby clothed with authority to sell transfer, lease, give or grant Jointly with the *person_mentioned*persons */person_mentioned*interested or who may hereafter become interested in the said league of *location_mentioned*land*/location_mentioned*, any part or portion thereof, and it is further ordered and decreed that in order to effect the said object, and with a view to give regularity and permananey to said association of present and future *person_mentioned*owners*/person_mentioned*, the said *person_mentioned*Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned* is hereby authorized and empowered to sign a constitution or charter for the government of the said *person_mentioned*association */person_mentioned*to make, agree to and consent to any rules or by-laws entered into by the said association of the present or *person_mentioned*future owners of the *location_mentioned*said league of land */location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*which may be deemed necessary for their government. Signed with assisting *person_mentioned*witnesses */person_mentioned*as the law requires at my *location_mentioned*offce */location_mentioned*in the town of *location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned* this *date_mentioned n="07-07-1830">seventh day of July in the year of Our Lord, 1830*/date_mentioned*,
*p*(Signed) *person_mentioned*Thos. Barnett*/person_mentioned* assisting witness*person_mentioned* L. Lesassier*/person_mentioned* Assisting witness *person_mentioned*Samuel M. Williams*/person_mentioned*,*/p*
*p*the words on first page "them" erased on second page the words "more valuable and" inserted, the third page the word "said" erased.*/p*
*p*I hereby Certify that I have carefully compared the foregoing copy with the original petition and decree in my possession and declare it to be an exact Copy of the original document.*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Houston */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="05-31-1837">May 31, 1837*/date_mentioned**/p*
